question: An equiconvex lens made of glass of refractive index <katex>$\frac{3}{2}$</katex> has focal length f in air. It is completely immersed in water of refractive index <katex>$\frac{4}{3}$</katex>. The percentage change in the focal length is
explanation: Focal length in medium <katex>$f_m$</katex> is related to air <katex>$f_a$</katex> by <katex>$\frac{f_m}{f_a} = \frac{n_g - 1}{n_g/n_w - 1}$</katex>. <katex>$\frac{f_w}{f} = \frac{1.5 - 1}{(1.5/1.33) - 1} = \frac{0.5}{1.125 - 1} = \frac{0.5}{0.125} = 4$</katex>. So <katex>$f_w = 4f$</katex>. Change is <katex>$4f - f = 3f$</katex>. Percentage increase = <katex>$\frac{3f}{f} \times 100 = 300\%$</katex>.
